com.opentok.cloud.controller

Class CloudController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.opentok.cloud.controller.CloudController

  • public class CloudController
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the root class for the Cloud Raptor SDK. To start a Cloud Raptor client session, call the CloudController() constructor, passing in your OpenTok API key and secret. You then call the initSession() method of the CloudController object to initialize a Session object. Then call the connect method of the Session object to connect to that session.
    See Also:
    Session

    • Constructor Detail

      • CloudController

        public CloudController(java.lang.String apiKey,
               java.lang.String secret)
        The constructor for the CloudController object. Use a CloudController instance to initialize Session instances.
        Parameters:
        apiKey - Your OpenTok API key.
        secret - Your OpenTok API secret.

    • Method Detail

      • initSession

        public Session initSession(java.lang.String sessionId)
                    throws java.lang.SecurityException
        This returns a Session object that represents an OpenTok session. The Session object provides access to much of the OpenTok functionality.
        Parameters:
        sessionId - The session ID.
        Returns:
        Session The Session object corresponding to the specified OpenTok session.
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - There is no OpenTok session for to the provided session ID (for the API key passed into the CloudController constructor).
